adudecalledleo.lionutils.entity

Class SpawnPacketUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • adudecalledleo.lionutils.entity.SpawnPacketUtil

  • @RequiresFabricAPI
public final class SpawnPacketUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for dealing with entity spawn packets.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static net.minecraft.network.Packet<?> create(net.minecraft.entity.Entity e, net.minecraft.util.Identifier packetID)
      Creates a S2C packet for spawning the entity on the client.
      Required for any entity that doesn't extend LivingEntity.
      static void register(net.minecraft.util.Identifier packetID)
      Registers a handler for an entity spawn packet received from the server.
      Should be used in tandem with create(Entity, Identifier) on the server-side.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static net.minecraft.network.Packet<?> create(net.minecraft.entity.Entity e,
                                                     net.minecraft.util.Identifier packetID)

        Creates a S2C packet for spawning the entity on the client.
        Required for any entity that doesn't extend LivingEntity.

        To use, simply override Entity.createSpawnPacket() with the following:
         @Override
 public Packet<?> createSpawnPacket() {
     return EntityUtil.createSpawnPacket(this, packetID);
 }
        Make sure you register your packetId on the client-side with register(Identifier)!
        Parameters:
        e - entity to create spawn packet for
        packetID - spawn packet ID
        Returns:
        a spawn packet for the specified entity

      • register

        @Environment(value=CLIENT)
public static void register(net.minecraft.util.Identifier packetID)
        Registers a handler for an entity spawn packet received from the server.
        Should be used in tandem with create(Entity, Identifier) on the server-side.
        Parameters:
        packetID - spawn packet ID
